title: Bowles: Bucs' 'inexcusable' loss falls on players

title: Lure of better life turns tribal youth into drug mules
content: Hundreds of tribal youth from the Agency areas of Alluri Sitharama Raju district languish in jail after getting caught with ganja¬†and charged under the stringent¬†NDPS Act, 1985. Many had been lured into the smuggling network by the drug mafia, dangling the promises of a quick buck or an expensive gadget. Harish Gilai finds out how extreme poverty, lack of employment opportunities and ignorance of consequences led them into taking a decision that sealed their futures

title: ASR district bus accident: Most of the deceased were from Chittoor
content: The ASR district police have already reported nine deaths and 22 injuries, officials confirmed that a significant number of the victims were residents of Chittoor district

title: When the urban and the jungle meet in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru is among the few cities in India surrounded by two protected areas. But calls for animal rescue have increased as the expanding city is pushing out urban wildlife from their natural habitats

content: The Congress leader was Union Home Minister from 2004 to 2008 and the 10th Speaker of the Lok Sabha from 1991 to 1996. He was the Governor of Punjab and also served as Administrator of the Union Territory of Chandigarh from 2010 to 2015.

content: The marine divers¬†emphasised that marine debris not only threatens aquatic biodiversity but also¬†impacts¬†fisheries, tourism, and coastal livelihoods

title: Piracy hits a brief pause, but web of leaks still unbroken
content: The recent arrests of movie-piracy masterminds have given the Telugu film industry a small ray of hope. Incidents of films being taped inside theatres have dipped, offering brief relief. But with piracy domains still thriving and fresh leak trails emerging from theatres in other States, the battle against organised networks remains long and complex, writes¬†Sangeetha Devi Dundoo

Her husband and neighbours continue to be entangled in legal battles in both countries, find¬†Alisha Dutta¬†and¬†Moyurie Som

title: Will establish peace, not buy it; to reopen old terror cases: J&K L-G Sinha
content: Terror victim families were left to struggle in silence for decades. Justice was denied to these families. The deep scars were never healed. Such families are now being recognised, respected and rehabilitated, says J&K L-G

content: The CAA-2019 is sacred law which is hope and assurance for persecuted minorities, said Odisha CM Mohan Majhi

content: Criticising Dinesh Sharma, who was Deputy Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh, Trinamool Congress said, ‚Äúdemonstrates that political rank does not equate to knowledge‚Äù.

content: Goa Nightclub Fire Tragedy LIVE News Updates: Authorities in Thailand on Friday started the deportation process to send back Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra back to India.

content: The NGO filed a writ petition, calling the Supreme Court's 2014 judgment of keeping minority schools out of the RTE Act's ambit "unconstitutional".

title: "Dying Easier": Unable To Learn English, Andhra Teen Dies By Suicide
content: A 17-year-old Dalit girl allegedly died by suicide over her "inability to learn English language" here on Thursday, police said.

title: Passenger Arrested With Two Endangered Monkeys At Bengaluru Airport
content: A passenger who arrived at the Kempegowda International Airport here from Bangkok has been arrested for allegedly smuggling two Red-Shanked Doucs -- an endangered monkey species -- and the animals were also seized, the Customs officials said.

title: Trump Planning New Superclub With India? All About Buzz On New Core-5 Grouping
content: US President Donald Trump is reportedly exploring a new elite 'C5', or 'Core Five', forum of world powers that would bring together America, Russia, China, India and Japan, sidelining the existing Europe-dominated G7 and other traditional groupings.

title: Bengal's 'Babri Mosque' Gears Up For Inaugural Friday Namaz, Thousands To Attend
content: The site for the proposed 'Babri' mosque in West Bengal's Murshidabad will host its inaugural Friday prayers today, in what is being seen as a new dawn in minority politics ahead of next year's state elections.

title: Will Ban Social Media Platforms If They Don't Cooperate, Warns Pak Minister
content: A Pakistan minister has warned that the government may consider banning social media platforms if they do not cooperate with authorities.

title: IAS Officer Removed By Madhya Pradesh For Brahmin Women, Judiciary Remarks
content: Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer Santosh Verma, who made headlines with his comments on Brahmin women and high court judges earlier this week, is now facing action as directed by Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Dr Mohan Yadav.

title: Sandeshkhali Witness, Injured Before Hearing, Blames Sheikh Shahjahan For Attack
content: Bholanath Ghosh has been described as one of the prime witnesses in the attack on Enforcement Directorate officials in Sandeshkhali in January 2024, as well as related CBI investigations that implicated Shahjahan.

title: "Irreparable Loss To Congress": Rahul Gandhi Condoles Former Lok Sabha Speaker Shivraj Patil's Death
content: Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed grief on the demise of Congress leader Shivraj Patil, calling it an "irreparable loss" to the party.

title: Gautam Adani Visits Pahela Kadam Vocational Training Centre
content: Gautam Adani spent the day at the Narayani Charitable Trust and its Pehla Kadam School, where he commended the institution for its work in supporting and empowering children with special needs.

title: 4 Flight Inspectors Who Oversaw IndiGo Ops Sacked By Aviation Watchdog DGCA
content: India's aviation regulator, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), has sacked four flight operations inspectors who oversaw safety and operational compliance of the crisis-hit IndiGo.

title: Indian Artefacts Among 600 "High Value" Items Stolen From UK Museum
content: Many artefacts from India dating back to the British Colonial era are among more than 600 "high value" items that were stolen during a burglary at a museum in Bristol.

title: Marital Rape Not Viewed With Seriousness It Deserves In India: Shashi Tharoor
content: Diplomat-turned-senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Thursday said he was shocked that India remains one of the few democracies where marital rape is not viewed with the seriousness it deserves, despite having stringent anti-rape laws.

title: Raids In UP, Gujarat, Jharkhand Linked To Rs 1,000 Crore Cough Syrup Racket
content: In a sweeping operation early Thursday or Friday, the Lucknow Zonal office conducted raids at 25 locations connected to a sprawling illegal codeine-based cough syrup network to the tune of Rs 1,000 crore.

content: The deportation process has begun to bring back the Luthra brothers from Thailand over the deadly fire at their nightclub in Goa.

title: "Hit Us, Abused": Woman Alleges Assault At Luthras' Demolished Goa Club
content: The woman, identified as Vaibhav Chandel - a resident of Mumbai who visited the club on November 1 - alleged that the club's staff spoke rudely, behaved inappropriately, and hit them with rods.

title: Massive Fire At Bar In Bhubaneswar. Thick Black Smoke Seen Atop Building
content: A massive fire erupted at a bar in Bhubaneswar this morning. Thick plumes of smoke were seen on the top floor of the building that houses the bar, in horrifying visuals from the Satya Vihar area in Odisha's capital this morning.

title: 6 Months On, Air India Crash Still Shrouded In Mystery
content: An Air India flight took off from Ahmedabad airport for London Gatwick Airport and crashed less than a minute later, killing 241 of the 242 people on board and 19 on the ground.

content: Several districts ‚Äî including Perambalur, Tiruchirappalli, Pudukkottai, Ariyalur, Tirupathur and Sivagangai ‚Äî have each crossed the 10-lakh mark in seed plantations

title: VIT rejects government report allegations, blames campus violence on misinformation
content: It claimed that 35 cases of jaundice had been reported out of over 17,000 students. Several students, however, have alleged that the University authorities had asked many who showed symptoms to go home

content: Employers and workers can register through Shram Suvidha, ESIC or MCA portals by December 31, says ESIC State Regional Director Malla Rama Rao

content: The Cabinet clears draft of A.P. Prisons and Correctional Services Act, 2025 intended to replace the outdated Central laws of 1894 with a modern correctional framework

content: Ratan Tata Innovation Hub has partnered with A.P. VFX, Animation, Gaming Association to offer hands-on learning, industry exposure, and startup pathways for students and creators, says its CEO

title: More than 4 lakh students trained in self-defence in A.P., says DGP
content: Self-defence training has been imparted to students in 12,873 schools and 1,315 colleges in the State, says Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Biennale welcomes visitors to experience art with all the senses
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate the sixth edition of Kochi-Muziris Biennale, themed ‚ÄòFor the Time Being‚Äô, on December 12; event to showcase works of¬†66 artists from 25 countries

title: The Madras High Court must break its silence
content: The High Court must clarify whether the method of the Collegium‚Äôs recommendations in the case of recent judicial appointments was in accordance with the Constitution and the Memorandum of Procedure

title: Court to pronounce sentence in Kerala actor rape case on December 12
content: The Ernakulam Principal Sessions Court will hear the arguments of the counsels of the convicts and the prosecution during the forenoon session

title: Rohini Acharya‚Äôs post again fuels talk of crisis in Lalu‚Äôs family
content: The deeply entrenched patriarchal mindset in Bihar creates the necessity for comprehensive social and political reforms; every young and adult woman should feel assured that her paternal home is a safe place --- one where she can return without fear, guilt or shame, the post read

title: Action will be taken against filmmaker Kunju Muhammed, says Chalachithra Academy Vice Chairperson
content: Police registered a case against him on charge of molesting a woman associated with the film industry while staying at a hotel as part of the Malayalam movie selection process for IFFK

title: Slave compounds in Myanmar, adjoining regions are hubs for execution of digital arrest frauds: CBI
content: The Central agency has filed a charge sheet against 13 accused persons in a major digital arrest case; it found that several key bank accounts used for receiving money from victims and routing the funds were being controlled by masterminds based in Cambodia, Hong Kong, and China

title: Supreme Court constitutes SIT to probe unnatural death of Scheduled Caste youth in Madhya Pradesh
content: The deceased‚Äôs widow and brother gave conflicting statements about who was responsible for the tragedy.

title: 'Do we deserve to be lynched?': How Luthra brothers sought relief in Goa nightclub fire probe
content: Delhi's Rohini court denied transit anticipatory bail to Goa restaurant owners Gaurav and Saurav Luthra, accused of murder after a nightclub fire claimed 25 lives. The brothers, detained in Phuket, failed to prove fears of being lynched in Goa. The court cited the grave nature of the offense and their conduct post-incident.

title: Watch: Pakistan assembly speaker finds money on floor ‚Äî 12 MPs raise hands to claim it
content: A humorous incident unfolded in Pakistan's National Assembly when the Speaker found PKR 5,000 notes on the floor. His call for the owner saw a surprising 12-13 MPs claiming the 10 notes, leading to widespread laughter and social media mockery. The money was eventually retrieved by an MP, but the episode sparked criticism regarding lawmakers' conduct and moral standards.

title: 3,500 pages, 300 witnesses: Charge sheet filed in Zubeen Garg death probe; CM vows justice
content: Assam Police's SIT has filed a charge sheet in a Guwahati court regarding the mysterious death of singer Zubeen Garg in Singapore. Garg passed away while swimming on September 19, prompting over 60 FIRs and a state-wide call for a thorough investigation. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed faith in the judicial process for delivering justice.

title: Jeff Bezos slips to No. 5 in world‚Äôs richest ranking, surpassed by Google founder
content: Sergey Brin, a Google founder, has surpassed Jeff Bezos of Amazon on the global rich list. Brin's wealth now stands at $240 billion, just ahead of Bezos at $239.9 billion. This shift is driven by a surge in Alphabet's stock. Google's AI advancements, particularly its Gemini model, are fueling this growth.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Vaibhav Suryavanshi explodes in Dubai; slams 56-ball century
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, scored a century in 56 balls against the United Arab Emirates. This happened in the opening match of the ACC U-19 Asia Cup in Dubai. His powerful hitting helped India recover from an early setback. Suryavanshi's performance propelled India to a strong position in the tournament opener. He announced himself as a significant batting talent.

title: Was Paige Shiver hired to expose Sherrone Moore? Inside the theory fueling the Michigan scandal
content: Former Michigan coach Sherrone Moore's firing and arrest have sparked intense online speculation, primarily focusing on operations staff member Paige Shiver. Theories suggest Shiver may have been hired to expose Moore, fueled by her continued presence on staff after his dismissal for an "inappropriate relationship." Michigan's silence has amplified these unverified claims.

title: 'Insult to House': RS adjourned briefly as no Cabinet minister was present; oppn reacts
content: The Rajya Sabha was briefly adjourned on Friday after the upper house noted that no Cabinet minister was present when proceedings started. Opposition MPs protested the absence of Cabinet ministers. The Lok Sabha also adjourned after paying respect to former Union minister Shivraj Patil and those lost in the 2001 Parliament attack.

title: Oracle stumbles: AI bets strain finances; shares drop after historic surge
content: Oracle's stock experienced a significant drop after reporting quarterly results that missed revenue expectations, largely due to substantial spending on data centers for AI customers like OpenAI. The company's heavy reliance on a massive OpenAI deal and its debt-fueled expansion have raised investor concerns about its financial stability and future growth prospects.

title: Rahul Gandhi chairs review meeting of Lok Sabha MPs from Congress; Shashi Tharoor not present
content: Rahul Gandhi led a crucial Congress strategy meeting in Lok Sabha, focusing on election reforms and parliamentary tactics. The session followed Gandhi's sharp criticism of Home Minister Amit Shah, whom he accused of evading questions and appearing nervous. The BJP countered, labeling Gandhi's approach as "hit-and-run" politics and urging him to listen to the government's perspective.

title: 'Stand-and-deliver doesn't work': Pathan explains why Pandya's spark vanished in 2nd T20I
content: Former all-rounder Irfan Pathan critically analyzed Hardik Pandya's subdued performance in the second T20I against South Africa. Pathan attributed Pandya's struggles on the Mullanpur pitch to his 'stand-and-deliver' style, suggesting a lack of footwork on a slower track. He also voiced concerns over Shubman Gill's T20I form and India's bowling issues.

title: 'Using AI coding tools across company': Zoho founder shares - issues a caution
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revealed the company is using AI coding tools, leading to significant productivity boosts for engineers. Experienced developers are completing tasks in a day that previously took weeks, while junior members are building complex internal tools with AI assistance.

title: IndiGo crisis: DGCA sacks 4 flight operations inspectors for oversight; airline asked to hire more pilots
content: The DGCA has dismissed four inspectors overseeing IndiGo after the airline failed to hire enough pilots for upcoming flight duty time limits, leading to disruptions and a temporary rollback of rules. Despite DGCA warnings, IndiGo denies shortages. Sources cite deep mistrust between pilots and management, worsened by pay changes, policies, and attempts to restrict pilots from taking jobs abroad.

title: Family rift widens as Lalu's daughter appeals to Nitish Kumar for 'safe home'
content: Lalu Prasad's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has voiced concerns about women's safety in Bihar, advocating for parental homes to be secure havens.  Her appeal follows a public fallout with her family, where she alleged accusations of ulterior motives behind her kidney donation to her father. Acharya believes societal and political shifts are crucial to protect women from exploitation.

title: 'They assaulted us': Before deadly fire, woman narrates horror at 'Romeo Lane'; what she said
content: Goa authorities are re-evaluating safety at Vagator's Romeo Lane after a tourist's account of a suffocating layout, rude staff, and violent assault by security resurfaced. The incident involved a barricade and physical attacks, leading to injuries. This comes as co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, linked to the club, fled India following a deadly fire at their establishment.

title: Karnataka CM buzz: Shivakumar hosts late-night dinner with 30+ Cong MLAs, ministers
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar held a dinner meeting with over 30 Congress legislators and ministers in Belagavi, amidst ongoing speculations about potential leadership changes. This gathering follows a separate dinner attended by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, fueling discussions about power dynamics within the ruling party.

title: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald to step down in January as sales continue to drop
content: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald is stepping down January 31 amid a challenging sales year, with the board seeking a successor.  The athletic wear brand reported a 2% net revenue decline in the Americas and a 13% profit fall in its third quarter, facing increased competition and market shifts. Shares rose over 10% following the announcement.

title: 'Saw some good signs': India coach backs out-of-form Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav
content: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate expresses unwavering confidence in Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav, despite their recent batting struggles. He believes the duo's class and past performances, particularly Gill's IPL record, assure their return to form ahead of the T20 World Cup. Ten Doeschate emphasised the team's absolute faith in their ability to deliver when it matters most.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold outlook for today? Here's what you should do
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are showing signs of exhaustion after a sharp rally, with technical indicators suggesting overbought conditions. Analysts recommend selling if prices fall below ‚Çπ1,32,300, targeting ‚Çπ1,31,700. A breakdown below this level could trigger a corrective slide, with resistance at ‚Çπ1,32,750.

title: 'Operation Langda': 5th criminal shot in the leg in a month in Bihar
content: Bihar Police are now shooting criminals in the leg during encounters to prevent escapes, a tactic unofficially dubbed 'Operation Langda'. This strategy has led to the arrest of several wanted criminals, including Rakesh Kumar, who was shot in the leg and apprehended in Patna after allegedly firing at police.

title: South Africa create history; become most successful team against India in T20Is
content: India suffered a significant 51-run T20I defeat to South Africa, leveling the series and marking their most losses against any opponent. South African pacers achieved a rare feat, taking all ten wickets. India's inability to chase over 210 and the large margin of loss highlight persistent challenges ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: ‚ÄòSurrender or bid final Lal Salaam‚Äô: CM Mohan Yadav claims Naxalism wiped out in MP
content: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav highlights the virtual elimination of Naxalism as his foremost achievement, stating that those involved have either been eliminated or surrendered. He also outlined plans to double farmers' income by reducing production costs and increasing irrigated land, and aims to make the 2028 Simhasth Kumbh a global spiritual event showcasing Indian culture and knowledge.

title: Former Union home minister Shivraj Patil passes away at 90; PM Modi condoles loss
content: Veteran Congress leader Shivraj Patil, 90, has died at his Latur home after a brief illness. A seven-time MP from Latur, he served as Lok Sabha Speaker (1991‚Äì1996) and Union home minister (2004‚Äì2008), resigning after the 26/11 attacks. Patil also held multiple ministerial portfolios and was Governor of Punjab (2010‚Äì2015). He is survived by his son, daughter-in-law, and two granddaughters.

title: First time after ‚Äòapple orchards-cancer report‚Äô, Kashmir leaders meet to discuss ‚Äògrave‚Äô issue
content: Kashmir's apple farmers face a grave health crisis as studies reveal a strong link between pesticide exposure and malignant brain tumors. Decades of unchecked spraying, often exceeding recommended limits, have led to alarming incidences of cancer in fruit-growing districts. Lawmakers are now demanding urgent action to protect these vital workers.

title: ‚ÄòTariffs are hurting American biz‚Äô: Lawmakers warn Trump; claim policies straining US‚ÄìIndia ties
content: US lawmakers of Indian origin have voiced strong concerns regarding Trump administration policies, including a $100,000 H1B visa fee and 50% tariffs on India. These measures, they argue, are detrimental to American businesses and are damaging the crucial people-to-people ties between the US and India, impacting economic and geopolitical interests.

title: ‚ÄòI stand with every Hindu‚Äô: Bengal LoP ‚Äòhonours‚Äô men who attacked food vendors; trio gets bail
content: West Bengal's Leader of the Opposition, Suvendu Adhikari, felicitated three men arrested for assaulting chicken patty vendors at a religious event, shortly after their bail. Adhikari stated his primary duty is to protect his dharma and Hindu brothers and sisters, asserting his legal team facilitated their release.

title: Coming soon: Prada signs Kolhapuri deal, to sell chappals for Rs 84,000
content: Italian luxury brand Prada has partnered with Indian artisans to launch a limited-edition Kolhapuri Chappal collection.  Priced at approximately $930, the 2,000-pair line aims to preserve traditional craftsmanship and showcase Indian heritage on a global fashion stage, with potential for significant export growth.

title: Fighting toxic air: World Bank clears $600m in funds; boost for UP, Haryana initiatives
content: The World Bank has approved $599.66 million in financing for two major clean air programs in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana. These initiatives aim to improve air quality, reduce health impacts, and strengthen both states as attractive business destinations. The programs will invest in clean cooking, electric mobility, and cleaner industrial practices.

title: Paige Shiver abortion claim sparks scrutiny on Sherrone Moore‚Äôs firing, arrest
content: Michigan football faces a deepening scandal surrounding former coach Sherrone Moore, whose firing for an inappropriate relationship escalated with viral claims of coercion and a forced abortion involving staffer Paige Shiver.  The university's swift action and police involvement fuel speculation about the true severity of the allegations, leaving the public questioning what remains unsaid.

title: Taylor Swift enjoys a calm Manhattan dinner with Este Haim as Travis Kelce support sparks new talk among fans
content: Taylor Swift was spotted enjoying a private dinner with musician Este Haim in Manhattan, showcasing a stylish and understated look. This outing follows a period of public appearances, including supporting Travis Kelce at a Kansas City Chiefs game, with fans speculating about upcoming birthday plans and future events with Kelce.

title: Candace Owens warns Erika Kirk as new Charlie Kirk clip goes viral
content: Candace Owens expressed anger after Erika Kirk, in an interview with Bari Weiss, criticized Owens' baseless conspiracy theories surrounding Charlie Kirk's death. Weiss accused Owens of profiting from lies, while Kirk urged her to "Stop." Owens felt Kirk and Weiss unfairly targeted her, escalating their public dispute amidst the ongoing court case of the accused shooter.

title: Fled by IndiGo, caught at Indigo: How Luthra brothers‚Äô escape plan crumbled; deportation next
content: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, co-owners of Goa‚Äôs fire-ravaged nightclub Birch by Romeo Lane, were detained by Thai police in Phuket after fleeing India following a blaze that killed 25. With passports suspended, they were tracked and held in immigration custody. Indian authorities aim to deport them within four days. Police continue investigating, having already arrested six staff members linked to the fire.

title: 'Pained by loss': PM Modi announces Rs 2 lakh for Andhra bus accident victims
content: A tragic bus accident in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitharama Raju district claimed nine lives and injured twenty. Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered condolences to the affected families. An ex gratia of Rs 2 lakh was announced for the next of kin of the deceased and Rs 50,000 for the injured from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund.

title: Foxtail millet, gongura paneer & more: PM hosts NDA MPs; what was on the all-vegetarian menu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted NDA MPs for a special dinner featuring a diverse vegetarian menu, highlighting regional flavours and millet-based dishes. The gathering followed the NDA's significant victory in the Bihar Assembly elections. MPs expressed optimism for future successes, with one predicting the next celebratory meal after West Bengal polls.

title: Rough November for Elon Musk's Tesla as US sales sink to nearly 4-year low
content: Tesla's November US sales hit a nearly four-year low, with cheaper "Standard" models failing to boost demand despite the end of EV tax credits. Analysts suggest these new variants are cannibalizing premium sales and that Tesla urgently needs new vehicle models to compete with upcoming cheaper options from rivals.

title: Rupee tumbles to fresh life-time low! Reaches to 90.52 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 90.52 against the US dollar on Friday, extending its sharp decline this year. This weakness is attributed to a widening trade deficit, strong corporate dollar demand, and US tariffs. The Reserve Bank of India has intervened to stabilize the currency, which has lost over 5% this year.

title: ‚ÄòRs 5 lakh will become Rs 2.5cr‚Äô: 3 men die in occult ritual; one body found with lemon in mouth
content: Three men, including a businessman, died mysteriously at a farmhouse in Korba, Chhattisgarh. The incident involved alleged occult practices and a money-doubling fraud. Police detained five individuals, including an occult practitioner. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of death, examining forensic evidence and financial dealings. The deaths have caused shock and anxiety in the region.

title: Rajinikanth turns 75: PM Modi, Stalin extend birthday wishes to ‚ÄòThalaiva‚Äô
content: Superstar Rajinikanth is celebrating his 75th birthday, receiving warm wishes from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin. Modi lauded his five-decade cinematic legacy, while Stalin praised his charisma and contributions. Rajinikanth, affectionately known as 'Thalaiva', continues to be an influential figure in Indian cinema, recently honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award.

title: Kant, gaming jargon ‚Äî and outrage: South Korea's 'impossible' English test goes viral; exam chief quits
content: South Korea's exam chief resigned after the English section of the national university entrance exam was criticized for being too difficult. The test's absolute grading system saw its lowest top-grade achievement since 2018, with many students and educators deeming the questions overly specialized and convoluted. This unusual resignation highlights the intense pressure surrounding the Suneung exam.

title: MLB buzz: Orioles could target Cubs‚Äô $400M star after Alonso blockbuster
content: Baltimore Orioles are making major moves, reportedly signing Pete Alonso for five years and $155 million, and are aggressively pursuing Kyle Tucker. These potential acquisitions would significantly boost their World Series odds, transforming them into a top contender. The team aims to add elite power and proven production, reshaping the AL East.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,950; BSE Sensex up over 300 points
content: Indian equity benchmarks Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened higher on Friday, reversing Thursday's downward trend. Despite continued selling by foreign institutional investors, domestic institutional investors' strong buying and steady mutual fund SIP inflows are providing support. Investors are awaiting key economic data releases.

title: Don't turn Liverpool chaos into Slot vs. Salah: Club bosses must step in

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: the 2025 NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams . can Nebraska, the no. 1 overall seed, finish undefeated and claim the program's sixth national title? will Kentucky return to the final four for the first time since winning its first national championship in 2020?

title: The most impactful women's recruit on every 2026 top-25 class roster
content: a look at the most impactful signee in each of the nation's top recruiting classes . the top scouts have a clearer picture of what next season will look like for many of them . last year, no one has done star power like USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb .

title: Men's class rankings: USC into top 10; Tennessee and Texas A&M join
content: the biggest winner of this most recent update was USC . both of their signees made enormous leaps in the player rankings . the Trojans jumped from no. 24 all the way to no. 9 despite not adding any commitments .

title: Everything Shams is hearing on NBA trade season: Where could Davis land?
content: 82 players signed in the offseason will become trade-eligible . 90% of the league can be moved . a top team executive says this is the "unofficial start to having real, high-stakes conversations" "this is the unofficial start" to having high stakes conversations, he says .

title: Falcons complete comeback as Bucs drop from first in NFC South
content: the Falcons came back from a 14-point deficit in the fourth quarter to beat the Buccaneers 29-28 . the win was capped by Falcons kicker Zane Gonzalez . quarterback Kirk Cousins, running back Bijan Robinson and tight end Kyle Pitts Sr .

title: LSU's Kiffin set to return to Ole Miss on Sept. 19
content: the dates for the first nine-game SEC schedule were released Thursday . all eyes are on sept. 19 when Lane Kiffin and LSU return to Ole Miss . the two teams split in 2025 after they split two matchups in 2026 .
